intro: Galianthe hispidula, commonly known as the hairy galianthe, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Galianthe hispidula is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its ability to attract beneficial insects.
